· 17 Edward 17 39
SEint Edward þe ȝungue &punctelev; wa&slong; k&ydot;ng of Enguelonde
Wel ȝoung he imartred was &punctelev; þo&rrot;uȝ t&combtildevert;cherie tricherie and onde
Þo is Moder moder þe guode Quene quene &punctelev; a&slong;e god God wolde was ded
his fader nam an oþur wijf &punctelev; þat luþur wa&slong; and qued
Þat sent Sent
Edward louede lu&ydot;te &punctelev; and euere radde luþur red
Bi hure he hadde ane oþur &slong;one &punctelev; þat ihote was Atheld&rrot;ed
¶Þe Quene quene louede hire owene
sone &punctelev; a&slong;e ech man deth is blod
Ake &slong;eint Seint
Edward heo louede lu&ydot;te &punctelev; fo&rrot; &slong;tepmoder is &slong;elde guod
heo wilnede mo&rrot;e þane aniþing &punctelev; þat seint Seint
Edward ded were
Þat hire owene &slong;one aftur þe king &punctelev; þe heritage bere
Þo þe king wende out of þis wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; seint Edward
and as is &slong;one
Aftur him wa&slong; king jmad &punctelev; ase lawe wa&slong; and wone
¶Þe guodne&slong;&slong;e of þis ȝoungue king &punctelev; ne ma&ydot; no man telle
he wa&slong; meoke and milde inouȝ &punctelev; and fair of flechs and felle
Debonere fo&rrot;to &slong;peke with &punctelev; ant with pouere men me&slong;t
Cha&slong;te and wi&slong; of con&slong;eil &punctelev; and p&rrot;u&ydot;te he louede le&slong;t
W&ydot;lde Men men ne louede he nouȝt &punctelev; þat rechele&slong;e weren of þouȝte
And wi&slong;e Men men to him he d&rrot;ouȝ &punctelev; and aftur heom he w&rrot;ouȝte
Aftur þe Erchebi&slong;chope of Caunt&combtildevert;burij Caunterburij &punctelev; seint Dun&slong;ton þat wa&slong; þo
Ech dede þat he wolde do &punctelev; þe me&slong;te del &slong;cholde go
Glad wa&slong; þe holie man of him &punctelev; and al þat lond al&slong;o
Of swuch a king þat heo&rrot;e louerd wa&slong; &punctelev; þat alle þing wolde wel do
Guod pai&slong; þare wa&slong; in Enguelonde &punctelev; and loue and muruþe inovȝ
Riche&slong;&slong;e and al oþur guod &punctelev; elle&slong; it were ȝwovȝ
Fo&rrot; ȝwanne þat heued hathþ gode&slong; Godes
g&rabar;ce grace &punctelev; and loueth alle guode
Wonder it were bote alle his &punctelev; þe betere heom onder&slong;tode
¶ To þe guodne&slong;&slong;e of þis holie Man man &punctelev; þe deuel hadde envie
And is &slong;tepmoder þe luþere Quene quene &punctelev; þat ful was of t&combtildevert;cherie tricherie
Fo&rrot; heo þouȝte Niȝht niȝht and da&ydot; &punctelev; ȝif heo miȝhte in ani manere
Þat seint Seint
Edward were aslawe &punctelev; and hire &slong;one k&ydot;ng were
Fo&rrot; he was elde&slong;t aftur him &punctelev; and þe kingue&slong; &slong;one al&slong;o
Þis luþere wumman narewe hire biþouȝte &punctelev; hou þis miȝhte beo do
To &slong;ome þat weren hire con&slong;eilers &punctelev; hire luþere þouȝt he heo &slong;eide
þat hu&ydot; holpen with &slong;ome G&ydot;le gyle &punctelev; to don þat luþere dede
Þis luþere Men men al&slong;o fo&rrot;thþ with hire &punctelev; weren in grete þouȝteHorstmann reads this word as "þuþere", which is not warranted, as the first letter is clearly an "l". However, the medial "þ" has been rubbed, and possibly deliberately erased. It may have originally been an "r", modified to "þ".
With ȝwuche g&ydot;le hu&ydot; miȝhten do &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; to ende
it b&rrot;ouȝte
¶So þat heo hadde to hire con&slong;eil &punctelev; Inowe inowe atþenende
Fo&rrot; fellere þing nis non a&slong;e wumman &punctelev; ȝware heo wole to vuele wende
Nadde þis ȝungue king ibeo &punctelev; in is k&ydot;nedom vnneþe
Bote þreo ȝer and E&ydot;ȝhte eyȝhte dawe&slong; &punctelev; þat he na&slong; ib&rrot;ouȝt to deþe
Fo&rrot; a da&ydot; he wente on hontethþ &punctelev; with is kniȝhte&slong; bi cas
In a fa&ydot;r wode in deo&rrot;&slong;ete Deorsete &punctelev; þat bi&slong;ide wara&ydot;gne Waraygne was
Fair wode þare wa&slong; þulke t&ydot;me &punctelev; ake nouþe heo is al adoune
Bote þo&rrot;ne&slong; and þunne bo&slong;ke&slong; &punctelev; þat &slong;tondeth bi&slong;ide&slong; þe toune
¶A&slong;e þis ȝoungue king wende on hontethþ &punctelev; a gret wille him cam to
· 17 ·
Fo&rrot;te &slong;eo is ȝoungue b&rrot;oþur &punctelev; and in eche manere he wolde it do
Fo&rrot; he wa&slong; þere a lu&ydot;te bi&slong;ide &punctelev; a&slong;e is &slong;tepmoder wa&slong;
In a toun þat men clepeden Co&rrot;f &punctelev; þat bote þ&rrot;eo Mile mile þanne it nas
A &slong;trong ca&slong;tel þare is nouþe &punctelev; ake þe ȝu&ydot;t na&slong; non þere
Þis holie man þouȝte longue &punctelev; are he at is b&rrot;oþur were
Ane fewe men with him he nam &punctelev; and þuderward he gan ride
his Men men pleiden and Arnden arnden bi þe weie &punctelev; and &slong;p&rrot;adden aboute ful wide
So þat with heom him ne bilefde non &punctelev; al one he was &slong;one
Ake naþeles fo&rrot;th he wende is wei &punctelev; a&slong;e he þouȝte to done
Þe court he biheold afer &punctelev; þare a&slong;e is b&rrot;oþer was
Þudere he wende wel mildeliche &punctelev; ake no man with him na&slong;
he ne þouȝte ⁁to no man bote guod &punctelev; ne no man he nadde misdo
Towar[d] is deþe fo&rrot;thþ he wende &punctelev; and mildeliche al&slong;o
Þo is &slong;tepmoder þe luþere Quiene quiene &punctelev; al one i&slong;eiȝ him come
heo þouȝte to don hire wille of him &punctelev; a&slong;e heo hadde hire red inome
Þe luþere Men men heo cleopede &slong;one &punctelev; þat weren at hire rede
And bi&slong;peken bi ȝwuche feolonie &punctelev; to don þi&slong; luþere dede
¶þo þis holie Man man wa&slong; neiȝ icome &punctelev; þe Quiene quiene aȝein him eode
With fair Me&ydot;ne meyne and gret honour &punctelev; and gret loue gan him beode
þe fe&slong;te þat heo with him made &punctelev; no tongue telle ne ma&ydot;
And &slong;wo&rrot; þat he &slong;cholde aliȝte &punctelev; and with hire bileue alda&ydot;
Nai certe&slong; dame &slong;eide þis king &punctelev; &slong;o ne ma&ydot; it nouȝt beo
Ake lat me &slong;peke with mi b&rrot;oþur &punctelev; fo&rrot; me longueth him to &slong;eo
Fo&rrot; er þane ich him habbe i&slong;eiȝe &punctelev; I ne wo&rrot;þe nouȝt bliþe iwis
Min heo&rrot;te is &slong;o muche opon him &punctelev; and no wonder it nis
¶A sire quath þe luþere Quiene quiene &punctelev; ȝwane it ne mot oþur beo
Fur&slong;t ichulle to þe d&rrot;inke &punctelev; and þu &slong;chalt him &slong;ethþe iseo
Iredi wa&slong; þe Botiler botiler &punctelev; and b&rrot;ouȝte him d&rrot;inke anon
Among þe oþere þat þare weren &punctelev; o &slong;ch&rrot;ewe þare cam gon
And welcomede him with fair &slong;emblaunt &punctelev; and made him Io&ydot;e ioye inovȝ
And cu&slong;te him Iuda&slong;es cos &punctelev; and &slong;one him þere aslovȝ
Fo&rrot; a&slong;e he &slong;toupede and cu&slong;te him &punctelev; redi he wa&slong; inovȝ
Þo&rrot;uȝ is wombe he smot a knijf &punctelev; and is gotte&slong; al tod&rrot;ovȝ
Þis holie Man man &slong;at up&rrot;iȝht &punctelev; and biheold is deþe&slong; wounde
he ne rod bote wel lu&ydot;te wei &punctelev; are he feol to grounde
And liet þere i&slong; swete lijf &punctelev; is &slong;oule to heouene wende
Alas lu&ydot;tel vuel þouȝte he &punctelev; þo þe &slong;ch&rrot;ewe is wombe rende
Ake he was luþur a&slong;e Iuda&slong; &punctelev; þat &slong;o feolliche him cu&slong;te
And with tricherie is wombe rende &punctelev; are he it euere wu&slong;te
Þo þis holie Man man imartred wa&slong; &punctelev; hu&ydot; þat him b&rrot;ouȝten þerto
Biþouȝten hou hu&ydot; miȝhten be&slong;t &punctelev; with þis holie bodie do
Into a dierne &slong;tude hu&ydot; wenden &punctelev; and þarinne i&slong; bodi hu&ydot; ca&slong;te
Wel filliche and &slong;tilleliche &punctelev; and bureden it þare wel fa&slong;te
¶ þo þis holie Man man imartred wa&slong; &punctelev; þe Quiene quiene hadde hire wille
Fo&rrot; liȝhtliche Men men holdeth euere with þe quike &punctelev; and þe dede i&slong; &slong;one &slong;tille
· 17 · Edward 17 40
Men nomen þo þat child Aþeld&rrot;ed &punctelev; þat wa&slong; þe Quiene quiene &slong;one
And aftur is b&rrot;oþur mauden him king &punctelev; a&slong; riȝht wa&slong; and wone
¶Þe heiȝe men alle of þe lond &punctelev; with him heolden echon
A&slong;e with heo&rrot;e p&combtildevert;nce prince and heo&rrot;e louerd &punctelev; and þene dede fo&rrot;ȝete anon
Ake among lowe Men men and &slong;imple &punctelev; deol þere wa&slong; inouȝ
hu&ydot; co&rrot;&slong;eden alle withoute god God &punctelev; þat heo&rrot;e louerd a&slong;louȝ
Ala&slong; hu&ydot; &slong;eiden ȝwat &slong;chulle we nouþe &punctelev; ho &slong;chal fo&rrot; us beo
ho &slong;chal u&slong; nouþe fram weo&rrot;re us
wite &punctelev; ȝwodere &slong;chulle we nouþe fleo
ho &slong;chal nou pai&slong; in londe holde &punctelev; o&rrot;e io&ydot;e is al ido
Of weo&rrot;re and wo we mouwen beo &slong;ikere &punctelev; al w&rrot;echhede comethþ u&slong; to
¶Grete wille hadden þe guode Men men &punctelev; of þe contreie bi&slong;ide
In &slong;um fair place þat bodi legge &punctelev; and &slong;ouȝten it wel wide
hu&ydot; o&rrot;treuweden wel þat it were &punctelev; in &slong;um foul &slong;tude ido
hu&ydot; &slong;ouȝten it ofte wide aboute &punctelev; and ne couþen nouȝt come þerto
On a time a&slong;e þis guode men &punctelev; of ware&ydot;gne Wareygne þare bi&slong;ide
In þe contre&ydot;e wenden and &slong;ouȝten &punctelev; þis holie bodi ful wide
hu&ydot; &slong;toden and biheolden biheolden heom bi&slong;ide &punctelev; þo i&slong;eiȝen hu&ydot; gret liȝht
And cler withalle aboute one place &punctelev; a&slong;e a piler &slong;tonde up&rrot;iȝht
¶Hu&ydot; þouȝten þat þere wa&slong; gode&slong; Godes grace &punctelev; þudere hu&ydot; wenden and &slong;ouȝte
And founden þere þis holie bodi &punctelev; and up of þe eo&rrot;þe it b&rrot;ouȝten
Þare wa&slong; wop and so&rrot; inov &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; &slong;eiȝen is gri&slong;li wounde
Ake ȝeot was heo&rrot;e heo&rrot;te glad &punctelev; and Io&ydot;ful ioyful þo hu&ydot; him founde
With wel fair &pflour;ce&slong;&slong;ion procession &punctelev; þi&slong; bodi fo&rrot;th hu&ydot; bere
Into þe toun of wara&ydot;ne Warayne &punctelev; and faire it bureden þere
In a churche⁁ȝerd of o&rrot;e leuedi &punctelev; bi e&slong;te þe churche a lu&ydot;te
Þare hu&ydot; bureden þat &slong;wete bodi &punctelev; with gret honur and p&rrot;u&ydot;te
A chapele þare is arerd &punctelev; a&slong;e þat holie bodi lai
In þe toun of war&ydot;gne Warygne &punctelev; þat &slong;tant ȝeot to þis dai
Þe put þare he wa&slong; feo&rrot;&slong;t ifounde &punctelev; a welle þare gan &slong;p&rrot;ingue
Fair and cler þat ȝeot ila&slong;t &punctelev; and i&slong; ofte gret botningue
Þat Men men cleopieth ȝeot to þis da&ydot; &punctelev; &slong;eint Edwarde&slong; welle
þare Mani mani
Miracle miracle hath ibeo &punctelev; a&slong;e þe contreie dethþ telle
¶Þat holie bodi la&ydot; guode ȝw&ydot;le &punctelev; þare it wa&slong; ido
In þe toune of wara&ydot;gne Waraygne &punctelev; and Mani mani man cam þarto
Þe tiþingue hov he imartred wa&slong; &punctelev; &slong;one &slong;p&rrot;ong wel wide
And þe Miracle&slong; miracles þat fo&rrot; him comen &punctelev; aboute in eche &slong;ide
An heiȝ ⁁hul Eo&rrot;l eorl Eo&rrot;l
⁁ þare wa&slong; a londe þo &punctelev; þat ihoten wa&slong; Alfez
Þat &slong;eint Seint
Edward louede muche &punctelev; þe ȝw&ydot;le he liuede her
Þo he heo&rrot;de of þe Miracles miracles telle &punctelev; þat o&rrot;e louerd fo&rrot; him w&rrot;ouȝte
Glad and bliþe he wa&slong; inouȝ &punctelev; a&slong;e ech Man man wel ouȝte
him þouȝte it wa&slong; wel vuele ido &punctelev; þat he lai &slong;o lowe þere
Þat he nere ibured in herre &slong;tude &punctelev; a&slong;e he wel wu&ydot;&rrot;þe were
Gret deol he hadde in is herte &punctelev; þat he was amo&rrot;þ&rrot;ed &slong;o
And &slong;wuch a creature a&slong;e he wa&slong; &punctelev; in &slong;o lowe &slong;tude ido
In deo&rrot;sete Deorsete he wende wide aboute &punctelev; to þe heiȝe men alle þere
· 17 ·
To Bi&slong;chope&slong; bischopes and to Abbode&slong; abbodes al&slong;o &punctelev; þat in Enguelonde were
And bad heom of þulke holie bodi &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; it þanne&slong; bere
To herre &slong;tude a&slong;e it was wu&ydot;&rrot;þe &punctelev; and þat hu&ydot; þareaȝein nere
his Me&slong;&slong;agers messagers he &slong;ende aboute &punctelev; fo&rrot; þis þing wel wide
And to þe Abbe&slong;&slong;e abbesse of wiltone Wiltone &punctelev; þat ihote wa&slong;
wilfride Wilfride
And to Eadithþe þe holie wu&combtilde;man wumman &punctelev; þat Nonne nonne also was þear
Þat was &slong;eint Seint
Edwarde&slong; &slong;u&slong;ter &punctelev; and þe kingus douȝter Edgar
So þat Bi&slong;chopus bischopus and Abbode&slong; abbodes &punctelev; and heiȝe Men men mani on
Togadere comen in a time &punctelev; a&slong;e hu&ydot; bi&slong;peken echon
¶To þis holi bodi hu&ydot; wenden &punctelev; and þo hu&ydot; þerto come
hol and sound hu&ydot; founden it ligge &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; þat bodi up nome
Al&slong;o hol it wa&slong; withoute weomme &punctelev; a&slong;e it euer er aliue wa&slong;
Þare na&slong; nouȝt on þat it i&slong;eiȝ &punctelev; þat glad and Io&ydot;ful ioyful þerefo&rrot;e nas
Ake Eadithþe i&slong; holie &slong;u&slong;ter &punctelev; to þat bodi o&rrot;n anon
And biclupte þat bodi and cu&slong;te it fa&slong;te &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e heom euerechon
Fo&rrot; gladne&slong;&slong;e heo lovȝ and weop &punctelev; tere&slong; wel mani on
Þo heo &slong;aiȝ hire b&rrot;oþur &slong;o aslawe &punctelev; and &slong;o &slong;ovnd of flechs and bon
ho&slong;o nadde neuere deol i&slong;eiȝe &punctelev; of hire he miȝhte þere
Þis heiȝe men with gret honur &punctelev; þat holie bodi fo&rrot;th bere
With gret &slong;ong and &pflour;ce&slong;&slong;ion procession &punctelev; muche folk þuderward d&rrot;ovȝ
Ore louerd dude þare fo&rrot; is loue &punctelev; fair Miracle miracle inovȝ
¶ Fo&rrot; tweie crupele&slong; þat in heo&rrot;e limes &punctelev; al furcrokede were
Mid gret hope leien in þe we&ydot; &punctelev; and abiden þe bere
ho&rrot;e lime&slong; bigunne to rechchen ariȝht &punctelev; and hole bicomen anon
Þare wa&slong; Io&ydot;e ioye and bli&slong;&slong;e inouȝ &punctelev; among þis men echon
¶His &slong;tepmoder þat him þareto b&rrot;ouȝte &punctelev; herof herde telle
hire ofþouȝte þo he swuch man wa&slong; &punctelev; þat he heo him let &slong;o quelle
Ope hire palefre&ydot; heo werth a da&ydot; &punctelev; aftur þat bodi to wiende
To bidde fo&rrot;ȝiuene&slong;&slong;e of hire mi&slong;dede &punctelev; ȝif god God hire wolde &slong;iende
¶A&slong;e heo wolde þuderward wiende &punctelev; and with hire mani on
hu&ydot; ne miȝhten make hire palefre&ydot; &punctelev; þat it ane fote wolde gon
hu&ydot; &slong;chouen it fa&slong;te fo&rrot;thþeward and d&rrot;owen &punctelev; and neuere þe betere it na&slong;
Þe Quiene quiene þouȝte on hire mi&slong;dede &punctelev; þat al þarefo&rrot;e it was
heo aliȝhte of hire palefre&ydot; &punctelev; and wolde afote gon
Toward þat holie co&rrot;s &punctelev; ake heo nadde power non
Aȝeinward heo miȝhte wel gon &punctelev; ake fo&rrot;thþeward fo&rrot; noþing
Heo bilefte þo it wa&slong; non oþur &punctelev; in gret deol and mourn&ydot;ng
Of hire mi&slong;dede&slong; heo repentede hire &slong;o&rrot;e &punctelev; a&slong;e manie Men men habbeth i&slong;ed
And cam to guod mendement &punctelev; are þat heo were ded
¶ Þis Men men ladden þis holie bodi &punctelev; with gret honur and p&rrot;u&ydot;te
To þe Abbe&ydot;e abbeye of Schaftesburi &punctelev; þare a&slong;e he lijth ȝu&ydot;te
Among blake Nonnene nonnene þat þare beoth &punctelev; and al&slong;o þare weren þo
Þat fram þe toun of wara&ydot;gne Waraygne &punctelev; is twenti Mile mile and mo
In þe no&rrot;thhaf no&rrot;thhalf of þe heiȝe Autere autere &punctelev; in þe walle bi&slong;ide
hu&ydot; leiden þis holie bodi &punctelev; þat manie men &slong;echez wide
· 17 · Edward 17 41
Into þulke Abbeie abbeie of Schafteburij &punctelev; &slong;eint Edward hu&ydot; ladde
Fo&rrot; þe k&ydot;ng Alfred is graunt&slong;ire &punctelev; þat hous arerd hadde
And made þarinne is douȝter Nonne nonne &punctelev; þat wa&slong; ihote
alȝ&ydot;ue Alȝyue
Fo&rrot; hoire loue he hadde þat hous arerd &punctelev; and muche guod þudere in iȝiue
An hond&rrot;et hidenene hidene of guod lond &punctelev; with hire he ȝaf þer
Þat hou&slong; al&slong;o freo in eche point &punctelev; a&slong;e he him&slong;ulf it heold er
In þis Abbeie abbeie
&slong;eint Seint
edward Edward &punctelev; lai on and twenti ȝer
So þat hu&ydot; i&slong;eien tokningue ofte &punctelev; þat he nolde no&combtilde;mo&rrot;e nonmore beo þer
Fo&rrot; ȝwane men comen ofte to is toumbe &punctelev; a&slong;e liȝthliche up hu&ydot; a&slong; bere
And heuen a&slong; up and doun a&slong;e hu&ydot; wolden &punctelev; a&slong;e þei it liȝht treov were
¶ Seint Edward cam al&slong;o aniȝht &punctelev; a&slong;e in a vi&slong;ioun
To an holi man þat þere wa&slong; neiȝ &punctelev; in an oþur religion
Go he &slong;eide to Schafteburi &punctelev; to þe Abbe&slong;&slong;e abbesse of þe hou&slong;e
Dame Ald&rrot;ed þat clene Maide maide &punctelev; þat is gode&slong; Godes &slong;pou&slong;e
And &slong;eie hire þat i nelle nonmo&rrot;e &punctelev; ligge þare ich nou do
Þat ich beo ib&rrot;ouȝt in an oþur &slong;tude &punctelev; and þat heo &slong;egge mi b&rrot;oþer so
¶Þis guode Man man amo&rrot;ewe aros &punctelev; and ne furȝat nouȝt þis ca&slong;
To þe Abbe&slong;&slong;e abbesse he wende of Schafteburi &punctelev; and tolde al hou it wa&slong;
Þis guode wo&combtilde;man womman wa&slong; glad inouȝ &punctelev; to þe k&ydot;ngue heo wende &slong;one
And of is b&rrot;oþur tolde him al &punctelev; and ȝwat þerof were to done
Welle þe k&ydot;ng wa&slong; one glad &punctelev; þo he iheo&rrot;de telle
So &slong;wete tiþingue of is b&rrot;oþur &punctelev; þei is moder him liete aquelle
¶He wolde habbe iwent to schafteburi Schafteburi &punctelev; In in &slong;h&rrot;ine him to b&rrot;ingue
Ac he wa&slong; &slong;o bi&slong;et mid weo&rrot;re &punctelev; þat he ne miȝhte fo&rrot; no þingue
Fo&rrot; i&slong; fon o&rrot;nen &slong;o fa&slong;te him upon &punctelev; þat he ne miȝhte þanne&slong; wiende
To heie Men men aboute in þe londe &punctelev; wel &slong;one he gan &slong;iende
And to wilfin Wilfin þe guode bi&slong;chop &punctelev; þat was bi&slong;chop þo
Þat hu&ydot; &slong;cholden with gret honour &punctelev; to
schafteburie Schafteburie go
And his b&rrot;oþur in sch&rrot;ine b&rrot;ingue &punctelev; a&slong;e riȝth wa&slong; fo&rrot;to done
¶Þe Bi&slong;chop bischop with þis oþur Men men &punctelev; to schafteburi Schafteburi comen sone
With &slong;wiþe fair &pflour;ce&slong;&slong;ion procession &punctelev; to is toumbe hu&ydot; wende
A &slong;wiþe fair Miracle miracle among heom alle &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd fo&rrot; him þere &slong;ende
Fo&rrot; anon so hu&ydot; openeden þat lid &punctelev; of is &slong;wete toumbe þere
Þare cam adoun þo&rrot;uȝ al þe churche &punctelev; a&slong;e þei it a mi&slong;t were
Among al þe p&rrot;ece þat þere wa&slong; &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; i&slong;eien alle with eiȝe
Fleuȝ amon among heom al&slong;o a m&ydot;&slong;t &punctelev; &slong;o &slong;wote þing neuere hu&ydot; er ne &slong;eiȝe
¶So &slong;wote was þe smul and guod &punctelev; þat alle þat þere were
Fo&rrot; muruþe þouȝten þat hu&ydot; &slong;toden &punctelev; in para&ydot;s and nouȝt þere
Þis holi bodi up hu&ydot; nomen &punctelev; with gret honour and p&rrot;u&ydot;te
And leiden it in a wel fair &slong;ch&rrot;ine &punctelev; þare a&slong;e it lijth ȝu&ydot;te
In þis manere he wa&slong; i&slong;ch&rrot;ined &punctelev; in þe on an twentiþe ȝere
Þat þe heiȝe men him b&rrot;ouȝten fro waram Waram &punctelev; and bureden him fur&slong;t þere
A þou&slong;end ȝer it wa&slong; and on &punctelev; after þulke &slong;tounde
Þat o&rrot;e louerd wa&slong; on eo&rrot;þe ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; and aliȝhte fo&rrot; u&slong; to grounde
¶His b&rrot;oþur þe king Aþeld&rrot;ed &punctelev; guod man wa&slong; inouȝ
· 18 ·
Edward wa&slong; i&slong; sone ihote &punctelev; þat to alle guodnesse d&rrot;ouȝ
Þat king was sethþe aftur him &punctelev; and heiȝ halewe in heouene is
Icleoped seint Seint
Edward aftur is vncle &punctelev; at We&slong;tMun&slong;tre Westmunstre he lijth iwis
¶ Opon Opon Miȝhelma&slong;&slong;e fourtenen&ydot;ȝht &punctelev; his da&ydot; fallez in þe ȝere
And amidde þe Monþe monþe of lu&ydot;de &punctelev; seint Edwardes dai þere þe ere
Nov god God fo&rrot; þe loue of heom boþe &punctelev; þet &slong;wete kingue&slong; were
To þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heouene þat hu&ydot; beoth inne &punctelev; with heom u&slong; b&rrot;ingue þere
